author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: Victim of anti-Semitic subway attacker thanks strangers help
text:
A 25-year-old woman attacked by a stranger spewing anti-Semitic slurs on a Manhattan train said fellow straphangers rushed to her defense.
“At least New York hasn't lost all of its charm,” the woman, who asked that her name not be used, said in an exclusive interview with the Daily News.
After finishing work Monday she got on a C train at Chambers St. At the 23rd St. station, her attacker got on around 8 p.m, holding a pamphlet with a swastika and photo of Adolf Hitler.
He started screaming in German, gave the Nazi “Heil, Hitler” salute, then confronted the victim. She believes he noticed the “I’m on team Hillary” sticker on her notebook as she held on to a pole while listening to her headphones.
Man shouts pro-Hitler message, calls woman 'dirty Jew' on C train 
"Very close — an inch from my face — he was yelling at me,” she said. “He called me a dirty Jew.”
He also yelled, “Heil the Hitler youth,” she said.
"And then he shoved me," she said. "I was standing next to the door and grabbed the door and stumbled onto the seat."
"There were two men who kinda stepped in,” she said.
Fake 911 call sparks chaos on Midtown subway train 
“Take a walk, take a walk,” the good Samaritans told him, she said.
"I do not know them — which I think is really cool,” she said of the men who intervened. “It was very reassuring."
The suspect ran off and the woman later reported the incident to police.
The NYPD’s Hate Crimes Task Force is looking for the man.
Man killed by subway train while leaning over platform (GRAPHIC) 
The suspect is described as white and in his early to mid-30s with close-cropped blond hair. He was wearing a dark blue jacket and carrying a black bag or briefcase.
“This behavior is not OK,” the victim lamented. “People shouldn’t think this is OK.”
“With the election of President Trump a lot of people feel that it’s OK to express their views even if they’re racist or anti-Semitic or anti-LGBT,” she added. “It just seems as if people think it’s more socially acceptable.”
The victim, who works for a state assemblyman, was not raised Jewish but her husband is Jewish and together they observe Jewish holidays and traditions.
Teen stabbed by knife-wielding commuter at Brooklyn train station 
The victim took to Facebook to vent her frustration after the attack.
“How can I help make American great again after Donald Trump has completely ruined it?” she asked. “In the wise words of President Obama, I am fired up. Ready to go.”
